required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A New Parameter Derived From DSA to Evaluate Anterior Cerebral Perfusion
clinical_study.official_title: The Association Between a New Parameter Derived From DSA and Outcomes in Cerebral Ischemia

brief_summary.textblock: This observational study focus on a new parameter of cerebral perfusion derived form digital substraction angiography.

detailed_description.textblock:
Ischemic cerebrovascular disease is an important cause of death and disability in the world. Digital Subtraction Angiography (DSA) is the golden index for evaluating cerebral blood vessels. We introduced a new parameter derived from DSA to evaluate the perfusion in middle cerebral artery (MCA) territory to predict the outcomes in anterior cerebral ischemia.
To study the possible relationship between the new parameter of cerebral perfusion derived from DSA and outcomes in cerebral ischemia（modified Rankin Scale）, we intend to retrospectively analyze the images derived from patients who undergone the DSA and follow-up outcomes（modified Rankin Scale）.

primary_outcome.measure: the outcomes between good perfusions and poor perfusions
primary_outcome.description: Results are reported as odds ratios (ORs) with 95% confidence intervals (CIs).

secondary_outcome.measure: the outcomes between good perfusions and middle perfusions
secondary_outcome.description: Results are reported as odds ratios (ORs) with 95% confidence intervals (CIs).

arm_group.description: We introduced a new parameter derived from DSA to evaluate the perfusion in middle cerebral artery (MCA) territory in anterior cerebral ischemia.(good perfusion)
We introduced a new parameter derived from DSA to evaluate the perfusion in middle cerebral artery (MCA) territory in anterior cerebral ischemia.(middle perfusion)
We introduced a new parameter derived from DSA to evaluate the perfusion in middle cerebral artery (MCA) territory in anterior cerebral ischemia.(poor perfusion)

study_pop.textblock: the study population is from primary care clinic

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Cerebral ischemia in anterior cerebral circulation
2. patients undergone DSA
Exclusion Criteria:
1. cerebral hemorrhage
2. Stroke or ischemia in posterior cerebral circulation

overall_official.affiliation: department of neurology Xi'an No3 Hospital
